p: In the current study, Streptomyces. sp. was the most dominant in the root tissues, whereas fewer species were isolated from leaves and stem. This finding was in agreement with previous studies of Verma et al. (2009), Kaewkla and Franco (2013), and Kemung et al. (2018); they stated that plant roots provided a suitable habitat for endophytic actinobacteria and genera Streptomyces are majority in roots. This may be associated with the fact that the rhizospheric actinobacteria can move along the internal plant tissues and can colonize the roots ( Golinska et al., 2015).
